Posts.Content: MaraSara wrote: I would like to know people's experiences with these types of biopsies. I also would like to know why mild tranquilizers are not offered routinely beforehand.b This is from my post immediately below. This is what I found out on my followup today. There's a cyst with microcalcifications in it, so they are aspirating that. There's also a cluster of microcalcification near my pectoral muscle, so they're putting me on a table to be scanned by a computer to place the needle. Log in to post a reply

If I do, it'll have to be to break up with him.

Posts.Content: MaraSara wrote: First came the notice in the mail stating that the centre tried to contact me several times for a followup. Then my doctor contacted me, saying, say, have you seen the notice from the centre? My followup appointment is at 8:15 a.m. tomorrow. I go to work right after. I didn't tell work. I'm scared. Scared that I won't get to work on time, scared that they'll find out I might have breast cancer, scared that I actually do have breast cancer. I remember those pictures of breast scars in Time magazine when I was entering adolescence. I have felt my own sister's breast replacement. I don't want to think about it, because maybe it is not true. But maybe I should think about it, in case it is. Log in to post a reply
